intro: Leucophysalis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which vary depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling daisies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is cultivated in various regions with suitable climates.
